DOC.brief_title: Middle High School Students ' Reactions Health Interactive Website : ASPIRE Reactions
DOC.detailed_description: Participants complete 2 separate part . Part 1 : For Part 1 , participant complete survey mental physical health opinion concern health information internet . The survey take 15-20 minute complete . Part 2 : If result survey show eligibility , participant complete Part 2 study . For Part 2 participant randomly assign ( roll dice ) 1 2 study group . Participants 1 3 chance assign receive standard care . Participants 2 3 chance assign use ASPIRE website . This do one know one study group well , , bad group . If participant assign receive standard care , show website information present ASPIRE , text form . Participants group sit front computer go onto website . Both ASPIRE website text-based website design middle high school student . The ASPIRE website video , activity , health information fact effect smoke , benefit meditation , healthy living . The text-based website health information fact smoking , benefit meditation , healthy living . Participants complete 3 4 session use either ASPIRE website text-based website throughout first semester . Each session last 40 minute . The use websites videotaped . Follow-Up Surveys : Participants complete follow-up survey opinion concern health information internet immediately complete last session website . The follow-up survey take 15 minute complete . Length Study : Active participation study participant complete follow-up survey . If participant continue onto Part 2 study , active participation complete Part 1 study . Other Information : Participants take part study school school program . During use website , study participant individually videotape audio record . The videotapes audio recording use help research staff analyze participant 's use websites . The video tap audio recording store password-protected encrypted hard drive store locked office MD Anderson . Only study researcher authorized member research staff allow use videotape audio recording ( research purpose ) .
